isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built Starting March 1, 2007 - Gauges

svcsubsecinfo.para: This chapter describes the optional gauges that are either installed or can be installed in the instrument cluster. If the vehicle was ordered without a desired gauge, one or more can be added in the field. Programming of the Body Controller (BC) and proper placement is critical. Certain gauges will only work in certain locations. Before adding the gauge to the vehicle, ensure that the vehicle can accept it. The outboard four gauges are the only ones that can be moved or added. They can be added by using the Diamond Logic® Builder software. Follow the steps below for adding a gauge to the cluster (those without Diamond Logic® Builder should see an International dealer). The following instructions can be followed for any of the four auxiliary gauge positions.

item.para: Using Diamond Logic® Builder, obtain a copy of the electronic vehicle file either by getting it from the vehicle or from history.
Select the proper software feature code for the gauge to be added, and add this code to the configuration.

Position the gauge in the desired location in the cluster by clicking and dragging it to an open location identified by a large blue circle. If the gauge will not move to a particular position, it is not designed to work in that location.
Once the location of the gauge is determined, save the configuration and program the vehicle.

note.para: Refer to the "How Do I - General Information" section of this electrical guide for information on how to obtain gauge, circuits, and sensor part numbers.

item.para: Remove the cluster shroud from the Instrument Panel (IP).
Remove the four screws which hold the cluster in place.
Tilt the cluster forward to gain access to the back of the cluster (use caution not to scratch the face of the cluster).
Remove all the connectors from the back of the cluster, and remove the cluster from the vehicle.
Remove the ten screws from the metal panel on the back of the cluster.
Remove the proper filler plug. See below.
Install the gauge using caution not to move the needle, damage the face, or get the face of the gauge dirty.
Connect the jumper wire in the socket directly next to the added gauge.
Replace the metal panel, and install in the vehicle in the reverse order of removing it.
